articles.description: The US Dollar has taken a swan dive after a 7% CPI print, and the currency is now oversold on the four-hour chart.
articles.content:
US Dollar, EUR/USD, GBP/USD, USD/JPY Talking Points:

articles.author: Rhik Kundu
articles.title: Why there is no recovery in sight for Indian airlines - Mint
articles.description: There is no recovery in sight for Indian airlines with a fresh wave of covid-19 infections hitting passenger traffic yet again. Carriers have already reported steep losses over the past many quarters. Mint analyses the challenges:
articles.content: Average daily fliers were at 65,000 for the week ending 15 May, 2021, the peak of the second wave of covid-19. In comparison, 187,514 passengers took domestic flights on 11 January this year, showed … [+2567 chars]

articles.author: Nehal Chaliawala and Ketan Thakkar
articles.title: Mercedes-Benz to assemble EVs in India starting this year - Economic Times
articles.description: The Stuttgart-based company will start making its top-of-the-line EQS electric limousine in India starting this year. Having entered Indias EV market in October 2020, the local unit of the company quickly sold its allocated units over the last 15 months.
articles.content: German carmaker Mercedes-Benzs Indian unit said it will soon start assembling electric vehicles (EVs) in India, even as American EV major Tesla continues to lobby New Delhi for reduced import duty on… [+3626 chars]

articles.title: Govt puts brakes on CEL privatisation after employees union approaches court - Deccan Herald
articles.description: The government has put on hold the privatisation of Central Electronics Ltd (CEL) after the employees union approached the court against the sale of the company to a little-known firm, a top official said Wednesday. Allegations of under-valuation in the Rs 21…

articles.author: ET Online
articles.title: India retail inflation rises to 5.59% in December, hits 5-month high - Economic Times
articles.description: India's benchmark inflation rate, measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI) firmed up to 5.59% year-on-year in December 2021, data released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation on Monday showed.

articles.author: PTI
articles.title: Oil at USD 84 again: Petrol, diesel price on hold for 68th day in a row - Economic Times
articles.description: On November 4, 2021, excise duty on diesel was cut by Rs 10 a litre and that on petrol by Rs 5 per litre, resulting in an equivalent reduction in retail pump rates.
articles.content: Petrol and diesel prices have remained unchanged for 68 days in a row despite a USD 16 swing in international oil prices and global rates again climbing to USD 84 per barrel, oil company data showed.… [+5041 chars]
